'''Gorbulas Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Gorbulas was the son of [[Orgulas Brandybuck]], the younger son of the [[Master of Buckland]]. He had one son himself, [[Marmadas Brandybuck]]. He died some time before [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]].<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Gorbulas'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref>{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref> [[Jim Allan]] suggests that the name ''Gorbulas'' combines the first part of ''Gorbadoc'' with the second part of ''Orgulas''.<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 202</ref>
